  Do not clean the inside of sukashi.

Curran

--- steven <steven_88_2000@...> wrote:

> Greetings everyone,
> 
> I am new to the group, and new to the study of
> nihonto, so 
> please indulge my newbie questions as best you can! 
> :o)  I 
> wanted to get your experienced opinon concerning the
> cleaning 
> of iron sukashi tsuba.  What's troubling me is that
> Sasano-
> sensei seems to indicate in his Early Japanese Sword
> Guards 
> that not only the rim and plate of an iron tsuba may
> be cleaned of 
> their red rust, but even the sukashi openings.  Of
> course, I have 
> read what Jim Gilbert says on his Tsuba site
> regarding cleaning, 
> and indeed Jinsoo Kim advises just the same: do NOT
> clean the 
> sukashi openings of iron tsuba!  So I am confused. 
> To clean or 
> not to clean, that is the question!  Many thanks for
> your informed 
> opinions... :o)
> 
> Steve
> 
>
